citation.article-title: Methanocorpusculaceae fam. nov., represented by Methanocorpusculum parvum, Methanocorpusculum sinense spec. nov. and Methanocorpusculum bavaricum spec. nov.

p.s: Description of Methanocorpusculum sinense sp. nov.
Methanocorpusculum sinense (M.L. gen. n. si.nen'se, designating China as the country of the sample for isolation)
Small, irregular coccoid cells usually occurring singly, < 1 μm in diameter.
Cell envelope consists of a hexagonally arranged S-layer with a center-to-center spacing of the subunits of 15.8 nm.
Glycoprotein subunits with an apparent molecular weight of Mr 92000 are found.
Methane is produced from H2/CO2 and formate.
No growth or methane production from acetate, methylamines, methanol, ethanol, 1-propanol, 2-propanol/ CO2, 1-butanol, 2-butanol/CO2 and cyclohexanol.
No growth observed at or below 15°C and at or above 45°C.
No dependence of growth on NaCl.
Growth factors present in clarified rumen fluid are required for growth.
G+C content of the DNA is 52.0mol% (Tm) and 50.0 mol% (HPLC).
Isolated from an anaerobic biogas plant treating distillery wastewater in Chengdu, Province Sichuan, China.
The type strain of Methanocorpusculum sinense spec. nov. is strain CHINAZ and has been deposited in the Deutsche Sammlung von Mikroorganismen und Zellkulturen GmbH (DSM 4274).
